name: Wick Editor Project
summary: Learn about .WICK files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Wick Editor is a free, cross-platform tool that allows users to create animations and simple games. Users can then export their animations and games as GIF, ZIP, or HTML files, for use in other projects or in their (or another user's) web browser.

While working on their Wick Editor projects, users can save those projects as WICK files. Each WICK file is a .ZIP archive, which contains an assets folder and a project.json file. The assets folder contains the project's assets, while the project.json file contains JSON-formatted data that Wick Editor uses to load the project.

description: A WICK file is a Wick Editor project. It is a Zip-compressed archive that contains the project's assets and a .JSON metadata file. WICK files are used to open projects in Wick Editor and export those projects in .GIF, .ZIP, and/or other formats.

instructions: You can open a WICK file in Wicklets Wick Editor (multiplatform). To do so, select the open button and then navigate to and open your WICK file.

If necessary, you can also expand a WICK file using any Zip-decompression tool, to view the file's assets and project.json file. You may have to rename your WICK file to use the .zip extension before you can expand it.
